projects.title: HTML/JS/PHP Reflection
projects.description: My first major assignment in the SCS was to recreate the Netmatters website using all the HTML and CSS knowledge I had gained thus far. I iterated upon this project twice in the course: first adding JavaScript features, then later converting it to PHP complete with database functionality.

projects.title: Pair Project
projects.description: I was paired up with another student on the course and given a website design to create from scratch. This was my first experience collaborating on a web project, as well as creating a consistent site-wide design from a single page concept.

projects.title: JavaScript Reflection
projects.description: This was my first project where I had a lot of freedom and could design a site with JavaScript in mind from the start. I was tasked with implementing an API that would load a random image which the user could then assign to a validated email address.

projects.title: WordPress Reflection
projects.description: Here I was tasked with create a site using WordPress. I created my own custom theme using the Underscores framework, and constructed the site with search engine optimisation in mind for the content, which consistently scored around 80/90 in Rank Math.
